reviewText: Absolutely Amazing.A Must for anyone with interest in World History of 19-20th Centuries
summary: Seven Wonders Of the Industrial World
Title: Seven Wonders of the Industrial World

reviewerName: David Thomson "Second Rate Eric Hoffer Imitator"
reviewText: I am amazed by the high quality of this production.  Seven Wonders of the Industrial World should be seen by everyone---especially younger students.  There are many heroes long dead who deserve our admiration and thanks.  Three cheers for the engineers of the world.  They have indeed richly improved our lives.  Sadly, however, they are normally ignored.  I particularly enjoyed the segment regarding the construction of the London Sewer System.  One is also encouraged to read W. Hodding Carter'sFlushed: How the Plumber Saved Civilization.
summary: Seven Wonders of the Industrial World is Worthy of Great Praise
Title: Seven Wonders of the Industrial World

reviewText: I love this collection, especially the one about the Impossible Lighthouse. Great historical and architectural episodes explaining what people had to go through to create these modern-day marvels.
Title: Seven Wonders of the Industrial World

reviewText: Brilliant show and highly recommend anyone to watch........but the price of $129 and one here for $300+ is ludicrous. I bought for $20 ( including postage) on Ebay , I see other re-packaged versions for around 18 pounds on UK Amazon which seem reasonable, but DO NOT PAY THIS PRICE.
summary: YES... but not at this ridiculous price
Title: Seven Wonders of the Industrial World

reviewText: I thought this might be an interesting documentary but was very pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the dramatizations. The Hoover Dam and Brooklyn Bridge segments complimented, rather than duplicated, other documentaries I'd seen and the London sewer episode- which I thought would be a snore- was fascinating. I'm eagerly hoping there will be a volume 2.
Title: Seven Wonders of the Industrial World
